Package controllers

Class CivController

java.lang.Object
controllers.CivController
public class CivController
extends java.lang.Object
Provides methods to calculate data about game state or act as a computer player that updates game state. This class contains all of the logic necessary to play the game, such as creating units, moving units, and determining when the game is over.
Author:
Connie Sun, Ryan Smith, Luke Hankins, Tim Gavlick

  • Constructor Details

    • CivController

      public CivController​(CivModel model)
      Constructor for controller
      Parameters:
      model - model that the controller will interact with to store the results of the operations it performs

  • Method Details

    • placeStartingUnits

      public void placeStartingUnits()
      Configure the map with the units that should exist at the start of a new game Each player starts with a Settler, whose initial coordinates are retrieved from the model. This method must iterate through all the Players once before the game begins to ensure each unit is matched with the correct owner player.

    • getTileAt

      public Tile getTileAt​(int x, int y)
      Returns the Tile located at the board location x, y
      Parameters:
      x - int for x of board positionn
      y - int for y of board position
      Returns:
      the Tile at x,y on the board

    • startTurn

      public void startTurn()
      Starts a player's turn by doing all of the "housekeeping" automatic game events for a player turn All Units have their movement reset, all Cities owned by a Player are incremented and updated. Do computer turn if it is the computer's turn.
      Parameters:
      player -

    • endTurn

      public void endTurn()
      Player ends their turn; the model moves on to the next player. This will update the curPlayer in model to be retrieved by controller for when the next turn begins. Notify the model if the game is over so that view is updated accordingly.

    • gameOver

      public boolean gameOver()
      When there is only 1 player left, the game is won.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise

    • isHumanTurn

      public boolean isHumanTurn()
      To determine if it is currently a human's turn or not
      Returns:
      true if it's a human turn, false otherwise

    • computerTurn

      public void computerTurn()
      Perform AI turn actions. The computer loops through all of its cities and does city actions, then loops through all its units and does unit actions. Settlers found cities, the first few units stay by their origin city and defend it, and the rest of the units move towards enemy cities to attack them. Calls endTurn() automatically when all actions are completed.

    • computerSettlerActions

      private void computerSettlerActions​(Settler s)
      Actions for computer's settlers. Try to found a city as soon as possible. Otherwise, move randomly and avoid attacking (this is only necessary if the computer is producing settlers, as these new settlers must move out of the city radius of control to found a new city).
      Parameters:
      s - a Settler owned by the computer player

    • computerDefenderActions

      private void computerDefenderActions​(Unit u)
      Actions that the computer takes for the first two non-settler units. These units remain close to the city and defend it against attackers. They move out of the city if newly created. They move randomly each turn and exhaust their movement to try to find an enemy unit to attack. These units will avoid moving into the city tile.
      Parameters:
      u - a Unit owned by the computer player defending computer's city

    • computerAttackerActions

      private void computerAttackerActions​(Unit u)
      Actions for computer units that move towards and attack enemy cities. Find the closest enemy city and move towards it by calling the moveTowards() method.
      Parameters:
      u - a Unit owned by the computer player attacking enemy city

    • moveTowards

      private void moveTowards​(Unit u, java.lang.Integer[] target)
      Moves the unit towards the target coords by searching for the ideal move first, then choosing any good move, and moving randomly if there is no "good" move. If target is in range, attack target. If y distance to target is greater than x distance, move in the y direction, and vice versa. If equal, move diagonally. If no move exists for these "better" choices, choose a random move. Continue moving until the unit's movement is fully depleted.
      Parameters:
      u - the Unit to be moved
      target - Integer[] of size 2 representing the x,y target location that the unit is to be moved towards

    • computerCityActions

      private void computerCityActions​(City c)
      Computer cities crank out warrior fodder each turn.
      Parameters:
      c - computer city attempting to create units

    • moveUnit

      public boolean moveUnit​(Unit toMove, int newX, int newY)
      Moves a unit from its old location to the new player-specified location. Unit moves one tile at a time. If an enemy unit or city on the location to move to, the move is an attack. Units cannot move on tiles with friendly units. Depletes remaining movement for the unit to move. Also deals with the case where the unit dies in a counterattack.
      Parameters:
      toMove - the Unit that is attempting a move/attack
      newx - int of new x location of unit
      newy - int of new y location of unit
      Returns:
      true if the unit successfully moved/attacked, false otherwise

    • revealTiles

      private void revealTiles​(Unit unit)
      Set all the tiles in the unit's sight range around the given location as revealed for that unit's owner.
      Parameters:
      unit - the Unit who is revealing tiles

    • attack

      private boolean attack​(Tile attackerTile, Tile defenderTile)
      Unit on attackerTile attacks the Unit on defenderTile. Unit gets attack modifier based on its current terrain; defender gets to counterattack. Movement for attacker unit is set to 0, as attack can only happen once per Unit turn. Removes a unit from the board and player if the unit dies in attack/counterattack
      Parameters:
      attackerTile - the Tile where the attacker Unit is located
      defenderTile - the Tile where where the defender Unit is located
      Returns:
      true if the attack was successful (meaning the attacker killed the unit and can move onto that space), false otherwise

    • attack

      private boolean attack​(Tile attackerTile, City defender)
      Overloaded method, to be called when a unit attacks a city Attacker attacks the city; city's health is checked. If <= 0, the city is defeated and removed from the owner's list of cities. This is how the game ends, so checks the end game condition as well.
      Parameters:
      attackerTile - the Tile where the attacker Unit is located.
      defender - the City that is taking the attack
      Returns:
      false for the moveUnit() method; never move onto a city tile

    • createUnit

      public boolean createUnit​(int x, int y, java.lang.String unitType)
      Creates a unit on the given location. Assumes that a valid tile coord is passed (i.e., only a tile with a city on it can create a unit). Checks that the city has enough in its production reserve to produce the specified unit type, checks that a unit does not already exist on that tile, and checks that the specified type is a producible (unlocked) unit. Updates the tile so that it has the new unit on it. Also depletes the movement, as newly created units cannot move.
      Parameters:
      x - int representing the x location of new unit (city tile)
      y - int representing the y location of new unit (city tile)
      unitType - String representing the type of unit to create
      Returns:
      true if the unit was successfully created; false otherwise

    • foundCity

      public boolean foundCity​(int x, int y)
      Found a city on the tile at x, y in the board Checks that the settler is still able to found a city and checks that the tile to found the city upon is not already within the territory of an existing city. Adds the new city to the current player's list of cities.
      Parameters:
      x - int of x location of new city (settler location)
      y - int of y location of new city (settler location)
      Returns:
      true if a city was sucessfully founded; false otherwise

    • updateCity

      private void updateCity​(City c)
      Expand the city's influence and check for resources on each added tile Iterates through the city's control radius and checks the new tiles in the updated range. Updates all of the tiles within the city's control to be owned by that city, and makes each tile check for a newly owned resource.
      Parameters:
      c - the City whose resources are to be updated

    • getValidMoves

      public java.util.HashSet<int[]> getValidMoves​(Unit unit)
      Returns a set of all the valid moves that the given unit can currently make. A unit can move onto a tile if it has enough movement left based on the cost of moving (1) and the movement modifier for the tile. A unit can "move" onto (attack) a tile with an enemy unit or enemy city but cannot move onto a tile with a friendly unit.
      Parameters:
      unit - the Unit whose valid moves are to be retrieved
      Returns:
      HashSet of int[]s representing all the valid moves for the given unit, where each int[] is of length two holding (x, y) coords

    • close

      public boolean close()
      Closes the game and saves the current game state.
      Returns:
      true if the game was successfully saved, false otherwise
